availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

body.p: Harrodsburg, Kentucky, planter. Virginia native. Married to Louisa Buckner. Father John T. Buckner, Davis M. Buckner, Richard A. Buckner, James H. Buckner, Mattie Buckner, Phillip Buckner, and Jesse Buckner. Planter in Washington County, Mississippi, in 1850. Owned eighty-three enslaved persons in Washington County in 1850. Planter in Harrodsburg in 1860. Owned nine enslaved persons in Harrodsburg in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Mississippi, Washington County, p. 274B.
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Slave Schedules, Mississippi, Washington County.

Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Mercer County, Harrodsburg, p. 4
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Mississippi, Washington County, p. 311.
